history.content:
Talk to your advisor asap. My semester off was a bit different because it was for tang-center approved medical issues, but from what I remember:

-You need to formally withdraw. Just click the option on cal central next to "add", "swap", and the other class options for spring 2020

-Readmission isn't guaranteed iirc, but since it's your advisor(s) who sign off on the paperwork allowing you to reenroll, if you talk to them ahead of time they should be fine with it

-Idk the exact deadlines, but thankfully my advisor sent me an email when that time came and I was still able to reenroll before enrollment for fall began

Hi,

I'm currently a junior, and planning to take the next semester off. If I wanted to do so, do I just not register for classes? How soon can I submit the readmittance form. Also, is readmission guaranteed if I have no holds?
history.subject: Taking next semester off
